title: F1 Fantasy is back for 2026
summary: A brand-new generation of F1 is here, with new regulations, new cars, new power units and fresh uncertainty up and down the grid. If pre-season testing has already got you guessing (and second-guessing), there’s an easy way to lean into the thrill – F1 Fantasy.

title: TAG Heuer sign Bruce for the 2026 F1 ACADEMY season
summary: F1 ACADEMY Official Partner TAG Heuer have confirmed that Megan Bruce will be representing them on the 2026 grid, with the Briton driving for Campos Racing.

summary: Williams have announced that Damon Hill is returning to the team as an Official Ambassador, 30 years after the Briton won the World Championship with the Grove-based outfit.

title: Hamilton vows ‘I’m not going anywhere’ ahead of 2026
summary: Lewis Hamilton has promised fans that he is “not going anywhere” as he took a moment to reflect on 2026 pre-season testing, with the Ferrari driver admitting that he is excited for what he has predicted will be “one hell of a season”.

title: Mueller and Schmitz first women to have corner named after them
summary: Laura Mueller and Hannah Schmitz are set to become the first women to have an F1 circuit corner named after them, with Turn 6 to be dedicated to them at the Australian Grand Prix in celebration of International Women’s Day.

summary: Kimi Antonelli has conceded that pre-season testing in Bahrain was not “the smoothest of tests” for him after experiencing some reliability issues, with the Mercedes driver expecting a “tight fight” amongst the top four teams when the campaign gets underway.

Season 8 won't change anyone's opinion
Long credited for its instrumental role in F1's mainstream breakthrough in recent years, Box to Box Films has stuck to its usual recipe that made Drive to Survive its most enduring sports documentary series. title: David Coulthard challenges fans' expectations: Excitement isn't measured in overtakes
summary:
Former Formula 1 driver David Coulthard has shot down claims that the championship needs a lot of overtaking for it to be exciting.

title: Will Buxton: Cadillac’s F1 project has already cost $1billion before a single race
summary:
Will Buxton says Cadillac's Formula 1 project has already become a $1billion undertaking as the American team looks forward to its first grand prix in Australia. 
Cadillac was approved to become F1's 11th team in March 2025, bringing the brand of General Motors into the championship which has, over the last few years, been rapidly expanding into the United States market.

title: Stefano Domenicali explains what Apple can do for Formula 1 that ESPN couldn't
summary:
Formula 1 CEO Stefano Domenicali has unsurprisingly backed the championship's partnership with Apple as the technology company takes on broadcasting rights in the United States from this year. The Italian added that the giant will be able to put F1 "in the houses of other people in different ways," as he looks forward to higher US viewership.

title: Ayrton Senna's 1986 Lotus F1 car hits auction for eight-figure estimate
summary:
Ayrton Senna's 1986 Lotus 98T Formula 1 car will go up for auction with RM Sotheby's. The car, which features the iconic John Player Special livery, is estimated to fetch between $9.5million and $12million.
The Brazilian driver piloted the Lotus 98T to win the 1986 Spanish Grand Prix and the 1986 United States Grand Prix. It also scored five pole positions and three podium finishes.
The ...Keep reading

title: Reliving Ford's F1 rollercoaster
summary:
History doesn’t always repeat, but it often echoes itself. So there’s something deeply resonant about Ford’s choice of team partner for its comeback as an engine supplier.
Red Bull Racing was born out of what’s easily the nadir of FoMoCo’s involvement in Formula 1. Having supported Jackie Stewart’s entry into F1 as a constructor in the late 1990s, Ford then bought the team ahead of ...Keep reading

title: Hannah Schmitz and Laura Mueller honoured at Albert Park as Australian GP renames Turn 6
summary:
The Australian Grand Prix has named Turn 6 of the Albert Park Circuit after Esteban Ocon's race engineer Laura Mueller and Red Bull head of race strategy Hannah Schmitz.

summary:
It looked like the Formula 1 door had closed for 2023 F2 champion Theo Pourchaire as he took up a full-time race drive in Peugeot’s WEC Hypercar programme this season. But it has creaked open just a fraction since Pourchaire has been announced – somewhat surprisingly – as an addition to Mercedes’ F1 development ranks.

title: The concern with straight mode which arose in F1 Commission meeting
summary:
McLaren boss Andrea Stella previously outlined three major concerns with the 2026 Formula 1 power unit rules and he has since revealed a fourth issue entered the mix.

title: Russell: Red Bull still holds best energy deployment in F1
summary:
Mercedes star George Russell is adamant that Red Bull holds the best energy deployment on the Formula 1 grid, with pre-season testing for the 2026 campaign now finished.
This year will introduce widespread regulation changes, and one of the alterations concerns the power unit, which holds more electrical energy, meaning battery harvesting will play a key role in grands prix.

title: Russell: My F1 2026 practice starts were my worst ever
summary:
George Russell claimed his two practice starts in testing for the 2026 Formula 1 campaign “were worse” than his worst ever, with Ferrari looking the strongest in that regard.  
Changes to the race start procedure has been one of the main talking points during pre-season, as drivers must now rev their engines for at least 10 seconds to spool up the turbo.

title: Russell thinks Mercedes needs work to make it four-team fight at the front in Australia
summary: "We have looked in the mix with several of our rivals near the front but it's clear, with Ferrari topping the times and McLaren and Red Bull Racing being right on their tails, that we need to continue working hard to bring more performance.”

title: Leclerc brings Ferrari to the fore as Bahrain F1 test concludes
summary: Charles Leclerc produced the fastest time of pre-season testing and took Ferrari nearly a second clear of the field on the final day in Bahrain.

title: F1 Bahrain pre-season test: Ferrari fastest as Aston Martin ends running early
summary:
Ferrari has achieved the fastest lap in Formula 1’s 2026 pre-season testing, courtesy of Charles Leclerc.
The eight-time grand prix winner topped the timesheet throughout the day. He was quickest in the morning with a 1m33.689s; in the afternoon, he successively brought this benchmark down to 1m33.629s, 1m33.162s and 1m32.655s with C3 rubber.
Leclerc then bolted on C4 tyres and lapped in ...Keep reading

title: Honda PU problems force Aston Martin to end Bahrain test early
summary: Power unit issues for Honda limited Aston Martin to just six laps on the final day of Formula 1 pre-season testing as the team ended its track running early.

title: Aston Martin ends F1 Bahrain pre-season test early after six laps on final day
summary:
Aston Martin curtailed its Formula 1 pre-season testing programme in Bahrain as an after-effect of earlier technical issues.
Having switched to a Honda engine supply for F1’s new era, Aston Martin is the only team to use the Japanese power units and has struggled so far.
Regardless of its mediocre pace, the AMR26’s unreliability has been the biggest issue at Sakhir.
The Adrian ...Keep reading

title: F1 Bahrain pre-season test: Leclerc quickest, Aston Martin restricted to two laps
summary:
Charles Leclerc significantly impressed by topping the final morning of pre-season testing for the 2026 Formula 1 campaign, while further problems struck Aston Martin in Bahrain.
The Ferrari driver set a 1m33.689s lap on the C3 tyre inside the opening hour, and that is the third session Leclerc has topped across the last two weeks.
Alongside going fastest, the Monegasque completed the ...Keep reading

title: F1 considering format changes, 12 sprints from 2027
summary:
Formula 1 is actively looking into doubling the number of sprint races from six to 12 per year from 2027, and is investigating other format changes to regular weekends.
F1's commercial rightsholder Liberty Media has been keen to expand the number of sprint races for a while as it has found they lead to more interest from fans, broadcasters and race promoters, even if they place a bigger burden ...Keep reading

title: Domenicali urges F1 'not to panic or overreact' over 2026 rules
summary:
F1 CEO and president Stefano Domenicali has urged fans to "stay calm" over the series' new 2026 regulations, which have already come under fire before the season has started.
F1's wholesale regulation changes for 2026 revolve around a much more powerful electric motor and sustainable fuels, measures which have attracted involvement from Audi, GM and Ford and enticed Honda to make a U-turn on ...Keep reading

title: F1’s Domenicali urges fans to wait and see how the new cars perform
summary: Formula 1 President and CEO Stefano Domenicali says the majority of fans will not be able to notice significant differences in driving style required by the 2026 cars and is confident the new regulations will deliver great racing.

title: 'Keep calm,' says Domenicali on criticism of new F1 rules
summary: Formula 1 boss Stefano Domenicali calls for calm in the face of criticism from drivers of the sport's new rules - but said changes would be made if necessary.

title: Explained: Why the FIA is putting Mercedes' F1 engine solution to a vote
summary:
In the weeks leading up to the season opener in Melbourne, the words “compression ratio” have dominated paddock conversations. Since rivals caught wind of the fact that Mercedes complies with the 16:1 limit during static tests at ambient temperature but is able to achieve a higher ratio while running, the topic has become political and inflated.
During the first week of pre-season testing ...Keep reading

title: After saying PU pushback ‘not worth the fight,’ Mercedes’ Wolff reacts sharply to questions about fuel
summary: Toto Wolff says it is not worth Mercedes fighting the other manufacturers over a proposed change to the way compression ratios are tested in Formula 1, but the Mercedes team principal then reacted angrily to further questions relating to its fuel homologation.

title: Ferrari innovation catches the eye as Mercedes again leads McLaren in F1 pre-season testing
summary: An innovative rear wing solution from Ferrari received plenty of attention on day two of the final pre-season test in Bahrain, as Mercedes again marginally beat McLaren to the fastest time.

title: Norris admits new F1 cars 'not purest form of racing'

title: Vote set for proposed change to F1 compression ratio tests
summary: The FIA has proposed a new approach to the way it tests for compression ratio limits, with Formula 1's power unit manufacturers to vote on whether to approve a mid-season change that could hamper Mercedes.

title: Russell tops Piastri, more Aston issues as final F1 pre-season test begins

title: Barcelona strikes deal to continue hosting F1 races until 2032
summary: Barcelona will continue to host Formula One races until 2032 as it strikes a deal that means it will alternate with the Belgian Grand Prix.
